math_1.1.name: Set Theory Basics
description: A set is a collection of distinct objects, considered as an object in its own right.
In mathematics, a set is a well-defined collection of distinct objects.

math_1.2.name: Set Operations
description: Basic operations on sets include union, intersection, difference, and complement.
Set operations provide ways to combine and compare sets.
math_1.2.notes: Important for understanding relationships between sets

math_2.1.name: Functions
description: A function $f: X \rightarrow Y$ is a relation that associates each element $x \in X$ with exactly one element $y \in Y$.
Functions map elements from a domain to a codomain with each input having exactly one output.
math_2.1.notes: Key concept in all areas of mathematics
references: Rudin, W. Principles of Mathematical Analysis

math_E1.name: Set Operations Practice
math_E1.statement: Given sets $A = \{1, 2, 3\}$ and $B = \{2, 3, 4\}$, find $A \cup B$ and $A \cap B$.
math_E1.description:
The union $A \cup B = \{1, 2, 3, 4\}$ contains all elements that are in either set.
The intersection $A \cap B = \{2, 3\}$ contains elements that are in both sets.
math_E1.hints: Remember that union contains all elements from both sets, while intersection contains only common elements.

math_E2.name: Function Composition
math_E2.statement: Given functions $f(x) = x^2$ and $g(x) = x+1$, find $(f \circ g)(x)$ and $(g \circ f)(x)$.
